result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey R. Otto was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order of Eligibility for Half- Priced Ignition Interlock Device (IID) /s/ RJS 02/06/17
Defendant Record Update

Defendant Jeffrey R. Otto in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:23 AM Court calls case.
Atty Hess states appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is an agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 3. Count 1 and 2 will be dismissed and read in. Count 4 will be dismissed outright.
Defense is free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: OWI 3rd offense
Count 4: Dismissed outright

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 3:
Jail sentence for 45 Days
3 days jail credit
Eligible for huber during the 45 days. Eligible for home monitor for the last half of the time if acceptable with jail administration
Report to jail TODAY
Pay a fine and costs totaling $2,067
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
IID for 27 Months
DL Revocation for 27 Months
Court does NOT order AODA Assessment - BAC: .109

Court signs the order for the half priced IID.

8:46 a.m. Defendant Jeffrey R. Otto in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress re: If whether the traffic stop was reasonable. Parties stipulated to video that Atty Drengler will be showing today. ADA Constable calls witness, Officer John Moss, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Witness has identified the Defendant in the courtroom.
8:53 a.m. Cross exam by Atty Drengler. No redirect. Witness steps down. State rests.
8:57 a.m. Atty  Drengler calls witness, Gabe G., who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
9:00 a.m. Cross exam by ADA Constable. Atty Drengler redirect. Witness steps down. Atty Drengler proceeds to present part of a video starting at 10:36:08 to 10:36:18 (10 secs) in duration viewed by the Court. ADA Constable final statements in objection to motion. Atty Drengler final statements in support of his motion. BTC: Motion to suppress is denied.
